1.content:
"It is not true what they say. Winter may be coming, but there is a distinct smell of blood and fire in the air. Not everything is as it seems. I, the Keeper of the Realm, have been around for thousands of years and have seen the Kingdoms rise and fall many a time. This is different."

"The seven deadly sins - wrath, greed, sloth, pride, lust, envy, gluttony - have been around since men stepped foot on this land. And yet, something new and evil sends an echo through the trees, rustling in the wind, expanding of its own will."

"Survival is what it is all about, but in the end the hunt and the need to climb the ladder in order to reach the Throne is what matters to these humans. The Gods, Old and New, can only watch and help guide these souls..."

My realm seems on the edge these days. No one is right in the head any more. In fact, the poor devils in the insane asylums are more sane than the rest of us or so it would seem. I sense a nervous fear is spreading into every heart that lets down its guard. People don't feel safe unless there are soldiers around, and yet, we live in a city with grand walls and impenetrable gates. Nothing and no one could get in here to harm them.

No, I do not think they fear weapons of cold steel. It is an invisible evil they fear, something that attacks the mind. It is as if a dark rain cloud has decided to settle over this realm and refuses to be moved.

I sent some of my spies into the city. They came back with reports of whispers - rumors. Some people think I am not doing all that I can to protect the realm from this evil. But I ask, what can I do against something I cannot see? I do not yet even know what I should be fighting against. Nevertheless there are still trouble makers. I hope this will not lead to rebellion and mutiny should they seek to uproot me, but I am preparing for the worst.

Queen Hannah sat astride her horse on a high hillock overlooking the inn, where rumors were said to be growing faster than ivy in summer. She watched as a lone man dressed all in black exited the door. His cape flared out behind him with a sudden gust of wind. The man turned and scanned the woods as if something or someone sought him then strode off toward the stable.

Keeping within the thick pines, the queen forewent the worn path down the hill. At the bottom, she waited until the man had saddled his massive war horse, climbed up and set off at a brisk pace. She kicked her smaller mare to a trot, keeping pace with the man, a spy for House Lannister she did not doubt.

Some leagues later, Hannah drew her mount up at the edge of a clearing and peered at the queerest sight: the man slipped from his horse with practiced ease, bowing low before three grey-haired women.

They were not old. They were ancient. Their skin cracked and weathered as centuries-old leather. When one stepped forward, Hannah heard a strange language but saw no movement of the old hag's lips.

It did not matter how hard Queen Hannah tried, or how long she waited her mind had simply gone to mush. Thoughts bouncing, swirling every which way, it was complete and utter chaos inside her head. That would be enough for anyone but to top it off Hannah's head suddenly began to pound. Clearly in pain, frustrated and yes even scared Hannah knew not what to do. It seemed everyone here was looking to her for a decision.

If only she could remember who she was, why she was in the woods, who the strange man was and why three hags were tied to the mighty tree before her. Part of her wanted to flee but something held her back, made her stand her ground. Duty perhaps? She really didn't know but she felt with all her heart that whatever was going on here was important, that many lives depended on the outcome. She just had to remember.

Watching Hannah walking in circles, muttering to herself with a look of utter determination he knew better than to interrupt. His Queen had to be coming up with a sneaky a plan for these hangs, to trick them into sharing what they knew. If there was a way, his Queen would find it. He silently wished she would hurry up and make up her mind. If he had his way he would simply torture one until the other two spilled their guts, it was highly effective, however the Queen was still displeased with the body count from the last time she sent him for information.

"Who are you?" asked Queen Hannah looking at the eldest of the three hags..

"We are three lonely hags who call this part of the woods home, but you already know that Queen Hannah, so tell us, what is it you are really want to know?"

Hannah's entire demeanour changes. She is once again standing tall, looking strong, confidant as ever and ready to take on the world. A look that an be mistaken for none other than our Queen Hannah of Stark.

"As your Queen, I demand you tell me what is going on, now. I don't have time for games so if you want to live I suggest you start talking!"

Daniel smiles and with unmistakable joy, he slowly removes his sword from its sheath. Ever eager to please his queen. So glad that whatever was bothering her before seems to have passed. Maybe, just maybe he would get to do things his way after all.

"You, Queen Hannah are being lied to by the very people that you call your friends and allies. Stark will come under attack and not from where you are expecting!" yelled the youngest of the three hags as Daniel began to toying with his sword, slowly tearing apart the bodice of her rags.

"Leave her be, leave them all be. We have work to be done and our time is not best served here!" Queen Hannah shouted.

How that woman could anger him. Though he had to remind himself, in the past she has proven to be sly, cunning and simply brilliant so this time he would keep quiet, for now anyway. Lost in his thoughts he was started when Queen Hannah suddenly shouted "Take me home, NOW!"

She never let him take the lead. Were they under attack, was she being cautious, devious or has she finally lost her ever loving mind? Thankfully he followed her command without question or at least she thinks he is as he is leading her somewhere. All she could do was hope he was loyal and home is where he is taking her. She could not have made it home without him for she knew not who she was, nor where she called home. Hannah rode in silence, there was too much to figure out and lives were depending on her.

The long winding woods were dark and depressing. the horses clearly knew their way, when Hannah did not. None of it looked familiar to Queen Hannah, why oh why could she not remember anything? This was clearly so frustrating for her. The man leading the way, he called himself her spy, he clearly worked for her. She had a nagging thought though, could he be trusted? Could anyone be trusted right now when she couldn't even trust herself? She had no choice she had to take his word for it, she was the Queen and they were headed back to the palace, Stark House he called it. Maybe one there her memories would flood back. She silently prayed they would.

As they rounded the bend going through the dense brush, Hannah caught a breathtaking sight between the tall standing trees she could make out the sunset and it was magnificent. The pinks, reds, oranges, purples and blues it was simply breathtaking. She brought her horse to a halt, she needed some time and now was as good as any. She called ahead and said she needed a few minutes but would catch up. She dismounted her horse and walked to a small clearing. The view there was more stunning than the first glimpse that caused her to stop. Looking out over the bare trees, the snow covered ground there was nothing. No foot prints, horse tracks, no animal tracks for that matter other than those belonging to that man she is travelling with and of course Sunflowers hoof prints.

Hannah stroked the mare's main, she was such a beautiful girl this horse was. She was in awe, that she could actually be the owner of such a magnificent creature! Come to think of it, Hannah realized she likely had many more possessions that would blow her mind being the Queen and all. How on earth did that happen? Hannah tried and tried but once again her mind a blank canvas. Chaos all around, thoughts flying, but when it comes to memories there is nothing. Just a blank canvas waiting for her to create new memories. Unfair, she wanted her old ones back! Frustrated and angry Hannah mounted her horse deciding she had had her fill of the sunset and her beautiful horse had finished drinking, it was now time to catch up to that man or she would never make it back to the Palace on her own. That thought scared Hannah and she sent her horse full throttle forward to catch up. Not slowing down until she caught sight of him ten minutes up the road.

She began to slow down once he was in sight. She didn't want him to see her anger, her fear and most of all her confusion. She was certain anyone could know just by looking at her that she was a fraud. She could only imagine how he might take advantage of her if he found out she had no memory. She had to remember, what could she do that would bring back her memories she wondered. Closing her eyes and taking more deep breaths in hopes of clearing her scattered mind.

As Sunflower was still running full out, a snake appeared suddenly, spooking Hannah's horse. Without warning while Hannah's eyes were still closed tight, Sunflower reared up on her hind legs, neighed at the snake and bolted faster than Hannah knew she could go. This wouldn't have been so bad if Queen Hannah had not been unaware and of course not on Sunflower's back when it happened. Hannah was slipped sideways on the horse but did not fall off. Sunflower was now galloping at full speed and quickly passed Daniel who looked on in horror as his Queen lay across the side of her horse only holding on by the reigns being caught up in her legs and skirts. Her hands were dragging across the dirt, ice and snow, her face terrified, her hair a tangled mess across her face and dragging along the ice covered ground.

He had to save her, if anything happened to her on his watch, he shuddered at the thought. Bringing his horse to a gallop he rode full out trying to catch up. If he could just get the damn horse to stop! Clearly it didn't follow verbal commands from just anyone. He needed to catch her and his best chance was grabbing hold of the reigns. Watching Sunflower he realized she was headed into a section of dense bush where both the Queen and Sunflower could be fatally hurt.

"Queen Hannah, you MUST free yourself from the horse and drop to the ground before you get even more seriously hurt! NOW!!" Daniel yelled. His heart raced so fast, the thudding in his ears, he had no idea if she could hear him. Quickly Daniel was able to narrow the distance between them.

Hannah could barely make out what he was saying, Her heart was pounding so loudly in her ears, and racing like it was going to jump out of her chest at any moment in time. She was sure she heard him tell her to drop. Humm if letting go and dropping to the ground was that easy doesn't he realize I would have done that by now! she cursed to herself more loudly than she realized and hoped he heard it, the idiot that he was.

She struggled against the reigns, ripping her petticoat and dress and she was finally able to free herself from the reigns. Okay, deep breath. She was still too dizzy, tired and scared to be able to pull herself back up on to Sunflowers back. So her only other option was to go home all the way like this or if she could just let go she would fall to the hard snow and ice covered ground. As Hannah tried to make sense of her options and make a decision, Sunflower got closer to the trees and suddenly with a loud crack and thud Hannah was run head first into the trunk of a tree. It knocked her unconscious and she fell to the ground.

Daniel couldn't believe his eyes, She was dead he just knew it. He got to her side as quickly as possible. By the time he reached her, she was lying lifeless on the ground. He couldn't tell if she was dead or alive. Packing back and fourth running his hands through his long hair he wondered what he should do. He could leave now, leave town and get far far away. They would blame him probably charge him with treason and have him drawn and quartered. You can't have the Queen die on your watch when you are out alone with her. People will think the worst. They will think he eliminated her in order to take over House Stark, Like that would happen with that greedy family of hers!! He stopped pacing long enough to look at his dear Queen once again. An honest and unsettling realization hit him, yes it is clear now... he loved her, as if on cue a lone tear slid down his cheek before he even realized it. She still hadn't moved. He began to make preparations to return her body to the castle. Looking around for something to make a travois so that his horse could drag her back with her dignity in tact and her position respected. Yes, that is what he would do.

"Sunflower, he called out in hopes that she would return unharmed. She was a beautiful horse, he wondered aloud what it was that spooked her for her to throw Hannah like that? So many questions. All that mattered was getting his Queen home, be damned with what the others may or may not think. He needed to bring her home to her family so that she can have a proper wake and burial. He wondered if she had ever thought about her death and what type of acknowledgement of her life she would have liked to have.

Time passed, each second turned into minute and each minute turned into hour as she waited hours for anyone to come inside. These hours felt like centuries. It was then she was hindrance in the light she could see from below the door, as if someone was there. She waited patiently, not getting her hopes up high and then the knob turned as the door opened revealing Daniel standing on the other side of her.

"About time you came, Daniel, I thought you'd left me," Queen Hannah spoke sarcastically putting emphasis on 'left' as she spoke. Daniel could taste the venom in her voice.

"Come on, you know I did it to keep myself safe and besides you needed to be treated, whatever made you so snarky and bi-polar needed to be removed from you."

"Well, have you now?!" She yelled, mocking him but his answer surprised her.

"Yes," He simply stated as if there was no need for any kind of explanation.

"Wait - how do you know if it has been removed from me?" She pointed her fingers at herself as she spoke, "See, I am still flaming, snarky."

Hearing this made Daniel laugh as he clutched his stomach and continued to laugh like a maniac. "What the hell, Daniel? This isn't funny, I am serious."

"Yes - yes, I know you are quite serious, it's just that, it was funny," He straightened up as he heaved a huge sigh, "The wizard made sure of that, now all your snarky-ness, is definitely because of the anger of being kept and chained here, nothing more. You'll get over it, I believe."

"You are so full of yourself." She stuck her tongue out at him, "Hmm, what if I don't get over it?"

"Hmm, then I guess I will have to chain you again and for longer period of time than I have right now."

Queen Hannah immediately jumped up, trying to stand but the chains stopped her as she fell down with a thump, "NO! You can't do that!"

"See, talking like that will only get you into trouble."

"Okay, okay. I am sorry, I beg you, please don't do this again, I hate being tied in chains. Now please will you open them?" She made her puppy eyes as she watched Daniel who was eyeing her up and down, his brow raised, this was amusing to him.

"That's a good girl," Daniel remarked as Queen Hannah's lips turned into a tight smile. She decided to keep quiet as she watched Daniel fumble keys out of his pocket and then step closer to her. He sat in front of her as he worked the chains off. As soon as they were off, Queen Hannah rubbed them, they were red but not sore.

"You are lucky these weren't swollen." She showed her wrists to him as he smiled.

"Yeah, lucky me. Okay, let's get a move on, we need to discuss a lot of things that happened while you were here."

"Yes, I need to talk about whoever he was who came in here to the wizard too, I need to see him now."

"Wait, what do you mean there was someone who came in here? You mean me? The wizard already knows about me."

"No, not you. There was someone else, someone I didn't know but he knew me."

"Who was he?"

"I don't know, I told you, he seemed to know me and called me all kinds of endearing words which I ddin't like at all. I wanted to see him myself but he said it was my fate and destiny to discover him, he wouldn't show himself. He was pitch black, all I could see was his reddish-golden eyes and nothing else, just a silhouette."

"That's . . . very strange. It's not possible. You must be imagining it." Daniel spoke as he got up and turned the light on in the room as the room was lighted.

"So you are saying I am crazy?!" She yelled at him, taking a look at him properly after a lot of days "Get me the wizard right now, we need to talk."

"I would have loved to carry our your order but unfortunately, the wizard isn't here." Queen Hannah noticed the criticism in his voice.

"Wait, what do you mean he is not here?" She asked, utterly confused.

"He left, a few hours ago, he was acting strange and he said he needed to leave."

"And you just let him leave? Just like that?"

"No, I tried to stop him but he said it was very important. No big deal, he said he will be back after a few hours."

"Well, I don't exactly see him right now . . . "

"He will come."

"You are putting a lot of trust into someone you don't know."

"Then do you know him?"

Queen Hannah didn't speak. She got up and then headed for her room. She was in a dungeon in her own castle, she had been there once but not more, she made her way directly into her bedroom and then lay there as she slept.

And then it began.

She saw strange symbols, she thought that she knew some of them, the language seemed familiar but at the same time, she didn't know what it was, she tried to understand it but nothing and then soon she woke up to find her in her bed, "It was a dream. . . he said it."

She didn't know what the symbols meant but she had to do something about them.

The symbols she had just seen were floating all over her drowsy mind, even as she tried to block them – those random crisscrosses each of varying color, varying size and each rotating at a different angle. It is the crisscrosses she remembered out of the near hundreds of symbols which had visited her subconscious mind only the crisscrosses managed to imprint them on her mind. But why, she wondered. She knew that she needed to talk about it to the Wizard but something in her told that probably she needed to do it herself.

“Queen Hannah,” it was Daniel who stood on the door of her room.

“In a moment, Daniel,” she said, as she went to wash her face to freshen up. She splashed her face twice or thrice till she could no longer see those crisscrosses buzzing her mind. As the cold water met the warm face of hers the instant connection of two opposites made her forget the symbols for a while. She splashed her face again till she felt much better than what she was feeling before. She took a deep breath to live the moment but sadly it couldn’t last long. That relief proved to be momentary as the symbols started to collide against the walls of her brain again. Even as she changed into her purple robe – her favorite robe which generally got her in the jolliest of moods - the symbols just wouldn’t go away, almost as if they had stuck themselves against the canvas of her eyes. A sigh escaped her lips as the feeling of being overwhelmed was now started to seep into his consciousness again. It was a curious situation for her because her stressed out mind wanted to share the secrets of the symbols with the Wizard but her innocent heart told her otherwise. And she was a heart person, by miles and she didn’t even try to reason her heart. A smile floated across her lips as she was now somewhat piece considering that she had made her mind about what to do with her new ‘friends’. She smiled looking herself in the mirror to avoid that plastic smile that people sometime pass on to anybody in sight and then, walked out of the room to meet Daniel. And then, as she saw Daniel she had a smile ready for him. Daniel bowed to her.

“Is the Wizard back, Daniel?” she started the conversation from where they had left before. Her voice had a finality and a firmness about it which hinted that saying ‘No’ was not an option – at least for her ears.
“Yes, Queen the Wizard is back,” Daniel said with a smile, thanking his stars for the return of the Wizard just moments before he set off meeting Queen Hannah.

Queen Hannah smiled back but said nothing, which surprised Daniel a bit.

“Err-Would you like to meet him, Queen Hannah?” Daniel said, almost biting his tongue as he said it. After all he was a spy and it was way beyond his powers to be suggesting something or anything to the Queen and that too as they stood face to face.

Queen Hannah noticed that fleeting moment of repent in Daniel. She said –

“No, Daniel but I would sure like to talk to you for some while,” she kept her tone as casual as possible so that it wouldn’t seem to be out of place to Daniel.

“Yes, Queen. What can I do for you?” Daniel did a little bow as the gentlest of smile decorated his lips.
Queen Hannah went towards the table where a large Silvery Jug full of water was kept. Daniel came running towards her, lifted the Jug almost snatching it out her hands and pouring the water into a glass.

“Water - Queen Hannah?”

Hannah was almost surprised by Daniel but she understood what she was doing. She waved her hand to signal ‘no’. Daniel kept the jug back on the table, a bit surprised, perhaps, as he took two step back. Queen Hannah poured the water out of the Jug onto the floor to form a tiny little puddle on the floor. Daniel looked on not understanding a single thing but he dare not interrupt her. He kept his eyes fixed on Queen Hannah who took her feet out of her leather shoes and dipped her toe into the puddle. Seemingly she was drawing something on the floor but at present it just seemed like random collection of lines to him. He wondered what the Queen was up to and whether this was a prank being played on him. Just then, she looked towards Daniel and said,

“Tell me, do you see anything?” she pointed towards the floor.

Daniel was already looking towards the figure on the floor, which had a curious shape alright a collection of many hashes (#) probably but meant nothing more. He moved around a bit, trying to make sense of it but nothing seemed to work. He didn’t understand it one bit and his face told it all to Queen Hannah.

“Okay,” she said and then changed them a bit, so that it looked like a collection of walking stick crisscrossed by straight lines. It made more sense than the previous figures but still not something in which he saw any meaning.

“Now?” she asked, her eyes a little expectant of something which would ease the burden of her mind; sadly though, no such relief came her way when Daniel moved his head sideways. When he saw the disappointment in Hannah’s eyes he felt so bad that he blurted gibberish –

“No – no, like I can see sticks – no, swords of those Kings from – “

“Stop Daniel,” she smiled. She knew what Daniel was doing, “You don’t need to say something just because I want it to work, okay?” Daniel nodded and Hannah continued, “You tell me when you really see something, fine?”

Daniel sensed the desperation in Queen’s voice despite her calm demeanor. She stooped low now, to draw those symbols which she saw in her mind, as accurately as possible. She closed her eyes to remember them in their finest details and then a smile flashed across her face. With the right thumb she struck through the mishmash of symbols she had drawn until now. Then, moving to the other side of the symbol she dipped the thumb in one of the stick shaped symbols and changed to look it more like an arrow. She did it for three other symbols and walked a little further away from the symbol. She tilted her head a little to the left, analyzed it from that angle and then asked Daniel to have a look at only the first three symbols, at once.

Daniel moved towards the symbol, and saw it with his head bent to the left but saw nothing. He then tilted his head left and although it didn’t made complete sense to him he at least knew that he had seen something of this sort somewhere. He walked even closer to the symbol and sat on his knees.

“Now Daniel,” Daniel jerked his head towards Hannah and saw that she had her right thumb raised to her eyes, “Do this now,” she gestured him to rub both of his eyes with his right thumb. Daniel found it silly, a bit childish perhaps, but a Queen’s order is a Queen’s order after all.

Still sitting where he was, he rubbed his left eye as quickly as he could, perhaps a bit embarrassed by what he was doing. Queen Hannah smiled at this urgency of Daniel as he rubbed his right eye too with an even more urgency than the first. All Daniel could see now was crisscrosses floating randomly, piercing each other but it lasted just for a second. However, it was good enough for him to notice something fishy in those few seconds. He rubbed his eyes again, vigorously this time in excitement more than anything. He saw those floating images again, swirling right in front of him as if trying to talk to him. In fact, one of them swam right across his left eye’s view and then, just when it was to disappear into his eye he saw two little eyes appear in that symbol, a tiny stubby nose and finally, a horrific mouth which was wide open, as if trying to suck his soul. Daniel closed his eyes shut in horror and the color of his face turned not a pleasant shade of white. His heart beat was rushing ahead like a train on steroids and he felt like even Queen Hannah could hear it beat. He slowly stood up and looked at Queen Hannah who stood beaming nearby.

Daniel had still not recovered from the shock and his eyes grew wider with every passing second. Queen Hannah stood their smiling as if waiting for Daniel to say it. When he opened his mouth to say it, Queen Hannah joined and they both said it together,

“The Silvery Ghosts!”

Daniel couldn’t believe what his eyes had just seen. He had seen the ghosts which going by the rumor had wiped of the practitioners of Voodoo magic from Stark some one and a half century ago. The ghosts didn’t stop at that – they cursed the Stark Realm which resulted in ravaging of Stark House by the ravenous Kingdoms across the seven seas. If it were not for Queen Hannah’s great grandmother who was a white voodoo magic practician, herself, the Ghosts would have chomped off member after member, citizen after citizen of the Stark Realm. But they had been gone for over three decades now so why did he see them in the pure air of the Stark? And worse even, why did Queen Hannah even ask him about it?

“I will tell you why, Daniel,” Hannah said, as she understood the myriad questions going on in Daniel’s mind. She told him the complete story of the symbols, how she had started to see them in his sleep as well as while he was wide awake. She then told him how she had found the key to the encrypted symbols just when she drew those symbols for him and a little insect hit her eye; that little insect which changed everything. She had to rub it out from her eyes and that is when she noticed the symbols having those impressions of silvery ghosts for the first time. Daniel still wanted to know that why they were seeing it now, was it anyway related to the Silvery Ghosts massacre, and should he be prepared to for an emergency in near future – he wanted an answer for all of those questions.

To that question, Queen Hannah had nothing much to offer apart from a look which said that she was busy reaching to the root cause of all the questions.

He glanced in Queen Aqua’s direction; Queen Aqua’s glowing face and the aura around her assured him that a person of such pure air around her possibly can’t hurt a fly let alone a human being. This train of thought gave him a lot of peace.

Daniel couldn’t bear the suspense any longer. Seeing that Queen Aqua was anyway not looking in his direction, he took a step in her direction so that he could see what she was seeing. Still no success. Another step but nothing changed. Just when he was about to take another sneaky step he heard –

“Daniel, I hope you are fine.”

Daniel’s heart leapt out of his mouth when he realized that the voice had come from behind the curtain. He moved towards the voice, as if in trance. Queen Aqua smiled, moved towards him and then raised the final set of curtain to reveal who stood there. There stood the Diva – Queen Hannah - who had called him.

Daniel hopped a step in shock. His eyes couldn’t simply believe what they saw.

“Am I dreaming?” he whispered still pulling back in shock, “Yes, I must be dreaming,” he reasoned with himself. The lady in the blue robe still stood there smiling at her. He looked towards Queen Aqua who stood glowing as ever, on the right side of the lady in blue robe who told her to be Queen Hannah.

“But I saw Queen Hannah disappear into ash, right in front of my very own eyes,” he clutched the decanter in his hand even harder. There was surely a decanter, in his hands. He opened it and flung the contents out of it and all which came out was mud, silvery smoky mud.

“Ash, see. Of Queen Hannah - ,” he said to lady in blue who stood smiling at him. What was this happening to him?

“T-the h-hag, the m-magic. W-wait, It did happen,” he clutched his head which was spinning like a tornado into his palm. He stooped down on the wood floor, questioning his mind whether anything had happened at all. He simply couldn’t believe anything which he saw, heard or felt.

His mind wanted him to be happy but such had been the previous few days that he found it difficult to believe almost anything.

“W-what ..w-who are you?” he yelled.

“Are you alright, Daniel? I think you are losing it,” said Queen Aqua, seeing that Daniel was showing signs of delirium. She was concerned about him.

“Of course,” he said with a hint of irritation but checked his caustic tone, ”Yes, I remember her. She was Queen Hannah’s sister - that cousin of hers who had been cursed when she was in the womb,” he mumbled.

“There was only one person who was cursed Daniel,” said the lady in the blue robe, “and it was you, Daniel. It was you,” saying this she came towards her, stooped to pinch the ashes from the ground and sprinkled it all around Daniel. Daniel felt a sharp pain in his chest, a pain as if hundreds of arrows had impaled him. He let out a sharp cry of pain.

~~~~~***~~~~~****~~~~~***

Queen Aqua and Queen Hannah were sitting on that mahogany carved seat in the garden, discussing the exotic plants and trees when Daniel too joined them. So engrossed were the two new found friends amongst themselves that they didn’t notice his presence. Daniel coughed a little which made Queen Hannah notice him.

“Daniel,” she exclaimed and walked towards her,” how are you now?” she said, putting a hand on his shoulder.

“I am okay, Queen Hannah,” Daniel said, with his head still bowed. He was now remembering things he had said before he went unconscious after Queen Hannah sprinkled the ash around him. The mutterings, the cuss words, the profanities which had escaped his mouth. Why, he didn’t know.

Queen Aqua too came forward towards him. He understood his dilemma and his guilt.

“It wasn’t your fault,” said Queen Hannah and Queen Aqua, almost at the same time.

Daniel’s eyes had turned watery. He looked up at them and said,

“What happened to me, Queens?”

Queen Hannah beamed a smile to him and said,

“You were cursed by the dying Hag. She simply wiped out me from your consciousness stream so that there would nobody to protect me when we would pass that forest. She made you saw all those things which you saw. I was with you the whole time Daniel, the whole time. It was around River Reborn that I noticed your strange acts first. You running towards the River and snatching the decanter off my hands, crying standing near Tora and Nora, talking to them and telling them that you would bring me back. I knew this was her black magic at work.”

Daniel had his mouth open, listening to all this.

Queen Hannah continued - “I had an inkling of it, actually, when she asked your name. I know the kind of curse they can bring upon the person and I knew that if it would happen then only two things would save you. One – the land of a realm which had purity ingrained in it and two, the –“

“The ash of the hag, right?” Daniel asked, with him looking with an awe towards both Queen Hannah and Queen Aqua who stood smiling.

“Told you, he is a bright one, didn’t I?” Queen Hannah smiled proudly at Queen Aqua who nodded full heartedly.

"So, how long have I been out?" Daniel rubbed his head, still uncomfortable even though the Queens had assured him that it wasn't his fault and that he didn't need to worry about it any longer.

"A few hours," Queen Aqua glanced at Queen Hannah who eyes her, teasingly.

"No, wait! It was a few days. You have been unconscious since the last three days. . . yes that was it." Queen Hannah replied and it was Queen Aqua's turn to eye her and laugh.

Daniel stood quiet, watching the two royal ladies laugh together, that was a good thing you know, two queens of two kingdoms together, progressing as friends, but they were laughing at him, that wasn't an ideal situation.

"Ladies, the gentleman is not at ease, please refrain from making fun of him." A familiar and different masculine sound came from behind them and Daniel turned around to see it was the butler, what was his name again?

"Oh, Sebastian! Don't tell me you weren't enjoying it, I saw you behind the door, listening." Queen Aqua had powers, powers that she never mentioned to anyone and no one knows what she is capable of.

"Okay, okay, I am guilty. Would you like some English Tea, Queens and Daniel?" Sebastian offered, looking at everyone, waiting for their response.

"Yes, yes, you should definitely try his English tea, I swear his are the best ones across the entire realm!" Queen Aqua spoke, her excited expressions showed how much she loved Sebastian's tea.

"Ooh, that sounds interesting, what is your secret ingredient?" Queen Hannah asked.

"Meh, you know, the usual - Lots of love." Sebastian spoke casually.

Everyone laughed at his comment, "What? I told you the truth! Let me get them for you, right away." Sebastian walked away, smiling,

As the door closed, Aqua's face became serene as she spoke, "Daniel, have a seat."

"Now, let's talk about the serious matter, what made you travel all the way from your kingdom to here, Queen Hannah?" Aqua folder her arms and looked questioningly at both of them, Daniel and Hannah.

Daniel and Queen Hannah exchanged glances, "Go ahead," Daniel said to Queen Hannah.

"We were journeying around our part of the kingdom to oversee some things when we . . . met my sister."

"Leah? But didn't she disappear?" Queen Aqua seemed to know more about Queen Hannah than Daniel, he wondered how she could have known all this, spies? Or perhaps were they both close in their childhood.

"Yes, she did, everyone called her mad, heck, I did too. And there she was acting all weird and stuff. She mentioned that there was something coming and we all would be destroyed by it. That was when she actually caught my attention and I listened to her carefully but you know her nature, don't you?" Queen Hannah looked at Aqua who was nodding affirmative.

"Yes, I know her, continue."

"She was playing, she didn't talk after saying this. I had a bad feeling about it and I thought that there is something she is hiding, something that is of a lot of importance. That is when I threatened to kill her, slice her throat and she gave it away."

"What did she say exactly?" Aqua's eyebrows were furrowed as she listened attentively.

"Well, the first time we heard what she said, I thought you sent her to us so that we will turn to you, become allies so easily. But then she denied it herself and this happened.

"You think Queen Aqua of Martell is behind this? You know nothing, honey. Go live a luxurious life in your castle." The hag tried to wave her off with her tied hands.

"Do you like death, hag? Do you crave it?" Hannah threatened her, still there was no effect on the hag.

"You think you can scare me queen? Nah, he's the one who everyone should be scared of him. Queen Aqua is already arranging her troops against him, you stand no chance alone, none of you kingdoms do." "

"Wait, how did she know about my kingdom? And that I am gathering force?" Aqua was confused, hint of anger on her face. Was there a spy among her kingdom? That wasn't possible, not a bit.

"I don't know, so it's true then?" Queen Hannah asked, her voice strained.

Queen Aqua sighed and began, "Yes, you might know that I have contact with the witches of the Silverstorm, Laura and the others as well as my own Beast Master (🛸 Sum1 🗿 ). They showed something to me that made me believe it even though I did not want to.

There is something spreading, something evil, lurking in the shadows, growing with each second as we speak. The dangerous thing and the weakness is that we do not know what it is or who it is, it is said that it is being controlled by the Dark Lord and his minions. As soon as I heard about it, I had started assembling my troops, they consist of both light and dark creatures, so we might hold an advantage."

"We will fight by you." Daniel spoke, "That's why we are here, Queen Aqua."

That seemed to have surprised Queen Aqua for she looked at Hannah for confirmation and only after she nodded did she speak, smiling, "That's excellent! For everyone's good!"

"Yes, but I've got one question." Daniel spoke.

"Yeah, shoot away."

"You say that you are assembling your troops. But when I came in the kingdom, there were no buildings, no citizens, no soldiers, no guards, nothing. . . " Daniel wasn't sure how to express this but he did anyway.

"Yes, that is a powerful spell that has been activated by my great ancestors. The spell spreads at least a thousand miles radius with my castle as the centre of the spell circle. Anything that has dark intentions will not be allowed to enter since there's a force field and those who enter easily, like you, have good intentions.

That is why when I saw you in the garden, I didn't feel as if I was in danger. And as for the city, the buildings, they lie behind this castle, whoever passes the castle till the end of its walls can see the kingdom of Martell. My army works in secret, underground and invisible camps, large fields. How about I give you a tour while you dispatch a message to your kingdom?"

"Yes, that would be a great idea." Queen Hannah spoke.

What Queen Hannah didn’t mention then was that she had a foreboding of things to come and even if the Hag hadn’t alerted her, she was sure that something was brewing in the deep Eastern part of the lands. The massacres in those deep forest of Brouu didn’t mean that the wild tiger and Lion had become extraordinarily devouring all of a sudden. It meant only one thing – that the beasts of the place were being rekindled by an outside force. An animal wouldn’t attack another being until it is hungry or it is being pushed into attack. The Lions, Tigers and Hyenas of Forets Brouu had ample of food supply, courtesy the acres of land the Forest was spread in. They had never been known to attack humans before – not in the memory of Queen Hannah and the fact that the animals started to do it, out the plain old blue, was something which had struck her as especially odd, at that point too. She had a passing doubt at that time but now, she was sure that the ugly spirits and the mercurial beasts roaming in non-human form and shape in that forest were gaining ascendancy. Somebody was working for them – digging them from the past, rekindling them, stoking their dark sides and forcing them on the souls of the animals. All of it made sense now. She winced a little.

"Thinking of something, Queen Hannah?” Queen Aqua asked Hannah who was diving deep into the recent past. She considered whether to tell Queen Aqua about those ugly beasts of Brouu but she hesitated; not because she didn’t trust her but because she wanted to counter this threat on her own. She was already feeling as if she was asking too much of Queen Aqua and she didn’t want to exacerbate the feeling. Queen Hannah diverted the topic -

“Wondering whether the people back home know that I am alive, that’s all,” a faint smile spread across her lips.

“Don’t you worry, Queen Hannah,” Queen Aqua gently squeezed Queen Hannah’s hand, “we can surely do this much for a Queen of such a benevolent kingdom.”

Hannah smiled again and nodded. Queen Aqua clapped her hands twice. A train of servants, all dressed in Off-white robe, came rushing to her with their heads bowed.

“Yes, Queen Aqua. What can we do for you?”

“Deliver the message to the great Stark Realm that Queen Hannah is safe and sound and in the company of Martel Kingdom,” she looked at Hannah to ascertain if that was enough. Hannah nodded, thought a while and then said,

“Just mention the word “Azure” in the letter, in some place where you think it would fit seamlessly like say right at the start where you address the Stark Realm,” Hannah smiled as she completed and so did Queen Aqua. Aqua didn’t ask for what “azure” meant and took it for some secret key which would signify to Stark Realm people that the message had indeed come from Queen Hannah herself and not some interceptor. But “Azure” was something which nobody was prepared for.

“Shall we move towards our base camps, Queen? ” said Queen Aqua as she motioned the servant on his way to House Stark.

“Sure,” Queen Hannah said. Daniel followed them. They all moved towards the fountain in the garden which stood right in between an Oak tree and a great Banyan tree. The Banyan tree, the grandest and oldest of them all, stood there as if guarding the fountain and the vicinity on its own.

Queen Aqua asked them, “Do you see what I see, Queen?” Hannah smiled back and nodded whole Daniel wondered what they were talking about. Of course he saw a Banyan tree and an oak tree and a fountain but what was there to ask about it. There was surely something which he had missed. He looked again, a little stern look than the cursory glances he gave it a while ago and slowly, he saw pattern emerge from the Banyan tree shoots.

“It is a set of swords that the shoots looked like,” Daniel murmured, “No, they are spears for sure,” said he squinting his left eye.
”No, no it is a bow and arrow!” he didn’t know what to make out of the weaponry which was seemingly appearing in thin air, right in front of his eyes. It was if the shoots would wave a little which would send dust flying towards the fountain. The sprinkling water from the fountain would settle on the dust particles to reveal the weapon like shapes. He also doubted himself whether his mind was playing tricks again with him. How can he be sure of it when so much had happened over the past week.

“Impressive,” said Queen Hannah and looked at Daniel whose mind was still trying to comprehend the act of pure magic unveiling in front of him. Queen Hannah understood that and said,

“It is no normal tree, Daniel, this you must have figured out, right?” Queen Hannah asked with a mischief in her eyes and Daniel blushed. He nodded.

“But do you realize that there is no tree standing in front of you?” Queen Hannah said it, looking impressed by this chimera.

“What?” Daniel moved towards the tree to try to touch and feel it. As he moved towards it, he saw the Banyan tree slip back a feet.

He again moved towards it but again the same thing happened. Daniel’s neck turned instinctively towards Queens who seemed to be enjoying the act.

“So,” he managed to utter a word after a moment’s silence, “What is this? Is this a magic, witchcraft, w-what?”

“It is a chimera, Daniel,” Queen Aqua said, looking proudly at the tall, handsome “tree” standing right in front of their eyes and still standing nowhere. Why wouldn’t she be proud of such an asset in her kingdom. It was the open secret of the Martel Kingdom; everybody knew that Banyan tree was a chimera but nobody knew the reason behind it – the hidden purpose it solved, apart from Queen Aqua that is and her mother and her mother’s mother and all the women in the lineage.

Queen Aqua looked towards Daniel and said “ You are going to eb the first Male to be knowing the secret of this tree, Daniel. How lucky are you! I had to wait for seventeen years to get this secret from my mother.

“But why is it exactly a secret kept exclusive for Women?” exclaimed Daniel, looking towards Queen Aqua then Queen Hannah and then again towards Queen Aqua for an answer. All he got from them was a smile.

“You will see,” Queen Aqua said and touched the Oak tree with the smallest finger of her left hand. She closed her eyes for a second and then, placed her palm on the Oak tree and caressed it. Lo, out jumped the Soldiers, all women, equipped with weapon of all those kinds which he had witnessed a while back. He was astonished not in any means by the weaponry but by the form which those lady soldiers had; they all were built from millions of tiny water droplets, arranged in a lady-figure. They had non-distinct facial features but their physical features were such that it was hard to not imagine the most beautiful of faces on that body form. And they just kept leaping out of the mirage of the Banyan tree, one by one, till their count had reached the magical sum of seventeen. As the water figures lined in front of them, apparently waiting for a command from their Queen, Aqua took her hand off the Oak tree.

She said -
“Welcome my army of the Aquas-17.”

Daniel couldn’t make a head or tail out of what he had seen. All what he knew was this must be special army. The fact that they were made of nothing but water droplets made him wonder what could possibly defeat them. Ice – No, can’t defeat them, Fire – No, can’t touch them. Weapons – what weapons could do to a water form! Daniel’s eyes went wider as he thought about it. And to top it all the Aqua-17 army had the weapons of their own. What troubled him for some time though, was the seemingly small count of the “battalion”.

“Just 17 of them, huh. How would they fair against an army of millions!” he muttered, gently enough to not be noticed by anyone in vicinity.

Queen Hannah looked mighty impressed with what she had seen. She didn’t remember if she had seen something like this in her life; the spirits of the Red Snow came close but this was something else. It made her wonder for a little time as to what happened to the Spirits of the Red snow but she brushed aside that thought for late user. Instead she said with a twinkle in her eyes –
“And do you know, what is the beauty of the Aqua-17, Daniel?”

“Apart from the fact that they are ladies, essentially, ” Queen Aqua chuckled. Daniel’s cheeks turned a darker shade of Red. He thought it safe to just move his head sideways to escape answering this tricky question. Queen Hannah had a grin on her face, too.
She then said -

“The beauty is that they don’t get destroyed but essentially multiply into even more Aqua figures.”

Daniel’s eyes went even wider in appreciation of the Aqua army and some moments passed before he got the genius of this army.
“Shall we move?” inquired Queen Aqua.

Queen chuckled as she spoke, "Okay, so let's get you feasted and then to your rooms."

Daniel slept peacefully, if it wasn't for the strange smell that was disturbing him, he would have kept sleeping. "What the heck is this smell? Is something burning? Come on, let me sleep."

As soon as Daniel's mind calculated what he had thought, he sprung up from his bed and yelled, "Smell!?" He looked around him to find everything around him on fire, the only thing that was left was his bed. He wondered how he was still safe, it was as if there was a protective circle around him that avoided any flame, even a sparkle of it to enter in the vicinity. Pushing the thought away to focus on the fire, he yelled, struggling to breath. He was suffocating due to the smoke in the closed room and his eyes were becoming watery.

"S-someone. . . " The words never left his lips because he started coughing violently. He heard the door open with a loud thud and a lot of loud voices which he was not able to make out as he surrendered to the darkness, to the unconsciousness.

He felt something wet on his eyes which made him blink them rapidly. The vision before his eyes came into focus as he recognised Queen Aqua staring at him.

"Don't you think you should call a person from the medical or perhaps your own wizard, Queen Aqua?" He recognised the voice, it was Queen Hannah's.

"What happened?" He got up, rubbing his head. His throat felt like burned and he coughed and Queen Aqua handed him a glass containing a liquid that was purplish in colour. He looked at Queen Aqua, who nodded, confirming that it was okay for him to drink it. He gulped it down his throat and felt immediately better.

"So, I remember there was a fire in the bedroom and I wasn't on fire and then I blanked out."

"Yes, you weren't on fire, that is what really disturbs me. I have enchanted all the rooms that whatever evil, whatever accident happens in a room, it doesn't spread to the other rooms. That is the reason why the fire didn't escape your room but you, I am surprised you don't have even a single bruise. . . "

Queen Hannah cleared her throat and Queen Aqua blushed, "Of course, I am really glad that you are fine but it just surprises me."

"Why does it surprise you?" Daniel was confused, why would she be confused,

"Because when I came into your room, everything was on fire, but you. You were lying on the bed and there seemed to be an invisible force field around the bed that protected me. I saw a flicker of fire deflected when it was flying over to you. No human can possibly have magic and do something like this. There is something about you, are you sure you are human?"

Daniel was beyond surprised, Queen Aqua's question left him dumb-founded as he stuttered. "B-but. . . . N-no, wh-why would I be not human?"

"There have been many events in the world where people don't know who they really are, maybe it's time we find who you are. What do you say?" Queen Aqua spoke, she was kind, she wanted to do according to what Daniel wanted, did he want to be the way he was, thinking he was human or would he like to know things he didn't use to about himself?

Daniel gave it a thought and then said, "Yes, I want to know. I may be more useful that way knowing what I am, what my strengths and weaknesses might be. I know it will be extremely hard for me to accept a completely different reality than what I believed in."

"Let's find out then."

He asked me if I want to know a secret and I say that I do," said Daniel.

Daniel squinted into the crystilline glitter, "I'm watching the boys at their training. Daniel stuttered to his feet as both the Queens stood either side of him. There was something special in that moment right there; not that two of the most beautiful ladies surrounded the hapless Daniel whose luck was finally changing for the good but the fact that Queen Hannah and Queen Aqua looked at each other, placed the thumbs of the right hand to each other which resulted in a ray of yellow light which basked the surrounding in its radiance. It was a marvelous site as if Lord Sun himself had come into the room to create that sparkling glory. Daniel found it odd that the although each and every object in the room had turned yellow in the magnificent shining in the room he himself was untouched by the glitter of yellowish gold. It was quite a curious scene with Daniel standing in a hollow bubble which guarded him from the brilliance of the color in the room. In fact, Daniel could no longer see Queen Aqua or Queen Hanna. He guarded his eyes with fingers of his right hand and then squinted through the gaps in the finger; all he could manage to see was two thumbs emitting color – as if it were a tiny fountain of sunray.

“I can’t see you Queen Hannah,” he whispered but got no reply. “Queen Aqua?” he said more in hope than anything else and nothing changed.

He tried to find a way out of the door of the room to escape the brilliance of the light which was starting to hurt his eyes a little. To his surprise, even when he opened the door of his room, a room very similar to the one he was before in appeared and to his utter surprise it was too bathed in yellow light. The similarity didn’t end there because some two hands away, he saw the two thumbs as if hanging in mid-air and oozing light all around.

“What does it mean? “ Daniel murmured.

The more he thought about it the more joined thumbs appeared in the room, each a little fountain of golden color in itself. He tried to touch them, catch hold of them and probably use it to get the Queens’ attention their but his utter surprise, his clasping fingers caught nothing more than air as it went through the figure appearing in front of him. His head was now started to spin again and almost out of pure instinct, he looked at his own thumbs and placed them together. He felt a surge of lightning pass through him as multitude figures and images flashed through his brain – a village nearby a river, attack of the Horse Riders on the village, the slaughter which ensued killing everything that breathed. And then he saw a little kid, with a face so angelic that it appeared to be of the God’s themselves, lying in the bushes surrounding the cottage being carried in the mouth of a silvery wolf.

He was still struggling to make sense of the things he was seeing but the bombardment of images in his head continued – he saw the silvery fox placing the little kid nearby a Black tree, height of which threatened to pierce the sky. As soon as silvery fox left, the leaves of the Black tree began to flutter manically and wind acquired a voice of its own. And then it happened - from that Black tree descended a Old man, who had flowing white man and an aura beyond description. For some reason, the legs of his seemed to be tied to the Black tree which stood there; however much he would try, he couldn’t free up himself from it. But he didn’t fret for one instant but rather smiled; a smile of hope, as if his savior was there.
The Old man stooped further to see the little kid lying at the root of the tree, checked the breath of the little pie and caressed its tiny little head. The old man then, drew a long breath and placed its thumb on the kid’s forehead to emit a streak of lightning which set the Black tree on fire. The tree burnt on rapidly as the wild wind stoked the fire even rapidly. The Old man hurriedly picked up the little kid and almost at the same time, jerked his legs to detach it from the remnants of the burning Black tree. A heart wrenching mourning emanated from the roots of the Black tree as the Old man kissed the child.
Streams of tear ran down the Old Man’s face as he caressed the kid’s forehead, as if wiping out his memory of what he might have registered subconsciously. The scene then changed to reveal a grown Up Daniel playing with the Old Man - Zula, his grandfather. Zula – the legend. Zula – the wizard.

The plundering images stopped then and there as Daniel stooped to his hunches. Hundreds of question ran through his mind.

Why did he do that? What was the reason he never taught me his tricks? Or did he teach them but it’s just I don’t remember them now? Was this the reason behind those pre-teenage dreams he often had where he would save his kingdom, destroying the enemies in the battleground not by the strength of his swords but by mere waving of his hands?

And most important question which plagued him now was “Am I a wizard?” Something in his heart nodded with him.

He drew in a huge sigh and lay on the bed, getting his head comfortable on the pillow. He turned to his left, with his eyes closed and then he felt something, breath on his face, he opened his eyes abruptly to find two red eyes looking at him, a crooked, evil smile lingering on the face.

"Hmm, you look scared, what is it, little pup?" He focused on the figure to see that it was the same hag at the tree, Queen Hannah's sister, she stepped forward and Daniel took a step back.

"Is it me? The one scaring you? You shouldn't be scared of me! It's her!" She pointed to the door and screamed, her appearance was hideous, her face was pale with the only two red eyes prominent feature of her face.

Her face looked agitated but then it turned into a creepy smile, a facade. "No, silly, I mean Queen Hannah."

In a blink of an eye, she was near Daniel, just a step away, yelling, grabbing his throat with her long nails that dug in Daniel's throat and he felt liquid running down his throat, it was his own blood. Her eyes were bloodshot and Daniel couldn't breath, he was beyond terrified. A bright light got his attention as he saw that the room was on fire.

"Burn, burn, all of you shall burn, one by one, you all will die. I will be back, honey." Her grip on Daniel's throat loosened and the entire room turned into darkness and the hag disappeared into it, leaving Daniel being encircled by the fire.

He woke up screaming, "Shh, everything's fine, it's okay, it was just a bad dream, everything is fine, breath with me. Come on, you can do this." He was panting, he did as he was instructed and his breathing calmed down, his eyelids heavy. "Sleep." The voice commanded.

"No, she will come again."

"No, she won't. I will be here to protect you this time. Sleep now." He felt soft hand ruffling his hair as it soothed him and he embraced sleep that he was previously denying.

The morning rays illuminated the Daniel’s room and the chirping of the birds hit his ears. He had had a rough night and took some more time for him to realize that the soothing chirping of the birds and the warm sun-rays were not a part of his dream. He slowly opened his eyes, only slightly opening them as if looking directly into the sun, and saw the magnificent brilliance of the room.
“This is a Good Morning, alright!” he muttered as he rubbed his eyes and slowly got up to a sitting position.

As he straightened his back, his hand went towards the back to apply some pressure on it in order to loosen it. That is when he felt that dampness. Some part of his cloth was still moist in the sweat which had been his partner for the night. It made him remember the nightmare he had seen at the night. Soon, he remembered that somebody had soothed him back to sleep when he woke up badly distressed. He jumped out of his bed and turned to look at the chair kept on the other side of the bed to see if that person was still there. But no, there was nothing in the room to suggest that he had been even visited by somebody else during the night. His handkerchief still lay on the chair along with his upright turban, exactly as he liked to place it before going to sleep. His eyes went towards the open window right behind his back. He ran towards it to search for any human existence there but no luck. In fact, when he looked down the window then all he could see was a sprawling garden and an exquisite pond in which Ducks and some other species of birds - which he didn’t knew name of - were swimming. Only thing near his window was a Brown colored Oak tree with curiously long branches decorated with the greenest of leaves and reddest of flowers. But the tree was at least some twenty feet away from the window and he found it difficult to believe that any human or animal could take this big a jump especially considering that the leap, if unsuccessful, could be not good for even the bones made of platinum.

“It too must have been dream then,” he told himself with the improbability of the event having not happened, still lingering in his mind. He shook his head as if to shake of the train of thought and went towards the restroom to freshen up.

A beautiful and delicate basin as if made of the gentlest of rose petals greeted him along with a life sized mirror which had golden rim all around it. He splashed water on his face and considered whether he should tell about the nightmare to the Queens.
“What harm would it do?” he said out aloud, as he fought with the thoughts of his mind who wanted to do otherwise. As he surveyed his face in the mirror, he noticed a huge bath tub in the exact opposite of where he stood. A smile flashed across his face as after all is there a better way to think of answers to your questions than to be lying in a tub of warm water and pondering over them.

**!!!~~~~~~~~~~~~

Some three quarters of an hour later, he was standing there with both the queens narrating his tale of woe. Unlike to what he (and his ego) had been wary of, both the wonderful Queens – Queen Aqua and Queen Hannah – patiently listened to his agony. Neither of them looked disinterested or stunned but maintained a calm around him which was in complete contrast to what was being exhibited on Daniel’s face.

“What a vivid nightmare that was!” Queen Hannah whispered, as if walls around her had ears. Queen Aqua nodded and looked at Daniel who seemed to share something more with them.

“Yes, Daniel. Something else?”

“Queens as much as the nightmare stunned and paralyzed me, I for once can disregard it as hyper activity and imagination of my fearful and stressed out brain. But what I am having difficulty passing off as something my mind conjured up is the presence of someone who soothed me, just at the stroke of that nightmare. Some motherly figure who sat by me, caressing my head and helped me drift into sleep,” Daniel raised his eyes to look at Queen Hannah and he had tears in his eyes. He continued –
“ I know all of it may sound like a complete hogwash but what I experienced at that time hasn’t been experienced by my since my mother died some fifteen years ago. It was the bliss of the mother’s touch that I experienced, I feel.” Daniel covered his face with his palms as stream of tear gushed out of his eyes. It had been building up for some time now and now, there was no stopping it.

What an adventure that was! You know what happened after that? I met a frog who for some reason seemed to be pretty interested in that little matchbox. He took it to his –“

Bony lady kept going on for another twenty minutes which felt like entire lifetime to Daniel. He wasn’t even listening to her harangue and what he heard in actual was Mumble followed by “Master” followed by more mumble. His eyes had that blank look of a husband who knows that her wife is talking about how he needs to do more housework. Daniel closed his eyes, took a deep long breath and tried to block out the Lady’s voice. He was partially successful in doing that since he heard “master” every 1 minute now instead of every 10 seconds. Daniel’s treasured moments of peace didn’t last for long as Bony Lady walked up to Daniel who sat on the chair, with eyes closed. She stood there for a while and then slid her one hand under her thigh –
“W-what i-in t-the –“ he pushed her back and she landed on her back on the floor, “What are you trying to do stupid woman?”

“I was trying to pick you, Master?” she smiled back to him, as if nothing untoward had happened.
“And why the hell was that?”
“I thought you were asleep and chair can be a bit uncomfortable for the posterior – it hurts mine, “she turned around and wiggled her bony tushy at him, “and hence I came to lift you and put you to bed.”

“But I was not sleeping,” Daniel screamed.
“But sleeping is not a bad thing, Master. Why don’t you admit to it?”

Daniel’s jaw was hurting mostly because he hadn’t gnashed his teeth so many times before in a single day, ever. He kept mum, still glaring at the lady who smiled like those lunatics in the horror movies of the old.
Several moments of silence stood between them with nothing but good intentions and flaring temperatures drenched the air. Daniel jerked his head away from the lady’s gaze and Bony Lady took it as a cue to come and stand to the new direction in which Daniel was now looking but thankfully he had closed his eyes again as in his mind he was thrashing this lady for the third time. Now he was twisting her head beyond what is allowed for anything that breathes – well, apart from the owls and it made him smile. He felt a little better and he opened his eyes to find the lady sitting at one arm distance from her. He was not overtly surprised considering the events of the past half an hour; he pulled his head back a little just to show to the lady that this was not what he liked.

“Are you okay?” he said in the most measured tone he had used while conversing with the lady, “pushed you and all that,” he felt a little guilty about his outburst. “Sorry for that lady,” he raised an arm in air for apology.

“Why, Master? I am perfectly fine,” She smiled, “is master okay?” she asked and Daniel nodded.

“Hmm,” he took a deep breath, “so what’s your story, dear?” Daniel asked, leaning towards her.

“Well, I don’t like to get too personal,” said the lady and Daniel’s eyebrow went up in surprise.

“What is this thing!” he wondered about her.

“Umm, since you seem to be very interested, I will tell you something personal,” she said, not looking at Daniel.

“And that would be?”

“That would be my anti-ageing techniques,” she beamed at Daniel. It was a good thing that Daniel was holding something on his chair else he would have fallen much to his embarrassment.

“So Master, can you guess my age?”
“But what’s the point of it?”

“Oh come on, Master. I know I don’t even look half my age and hence asking my age is pointless but that is the whole point, you know,” she wiggle her bony fingers the whole time she talked. “I am full seven hundred thirty two years old and – “

“But matchboxes weren’t invented seven hundred thirty two years ago, were they?” Daniel interrupted.
“No, of course not, Master. In those times I co-habited with a lousy genie who – what do I say about him – he made babies by dozens with me. That is when I decided to move out of the lamp and live on a tree. But then the monkeys thought I was some kind of itching device and used me for their backs, arms and - ”
“Okay, okay enough details about the places you itched. How were you born?”
“Naughty, Master,” she jiggled her shoulders a bit, “I am not telling you that.”
“O-oh. No no not the process, of course I know the process but who gave you birth?”
“You don’t know who gives birth to genies, Master?” Daniel shrugged his shoulders in reply.
“Goats give us birth, Master. The wild ones,” she smiled.
“Wait. What. The Goat goat, huh? The one which gives milk and has that beard on their chin that goat,”
“Excuse me, Master, you are making fun of my mother.”
Daniel was stunned not for the first time. He was brave enough to ask the next question –
“And fathers?” and he saw Bony lady’s facial expression change and so he corrected himself, “it must be the Male Goats, right? Of course, what kind of question was that!”

“No Master, Male goats are not our father. They are too ugly to bear beautiful child like us,” she smiled her best smile, the one which doesn’t show her tooth gap.
Daniel looked at Bony lady and studied her. She sure had the body of a goat – a malnourished goat maybe – but a goat sure. That is why she had that hint of hair on this chin which he had been mistaking for mosquito till then. He continued -

“So you were saying that the Goats are not your father then who is?”

“What do you mean by “are” your father?” this is the first time she hadn’t added master in her conversation. Must have pinched her real bad.
“I mean if Goat“is” not your father then who is, right?” Daniel corrected his statement.

Bony lady said -“No, ugly Goats are not our father,” Daniel wanted to stop her right there and tell her to correct “Goats are” to “Goats is” but what was the point, he thought after all he stood there talking to a bone frame, who was supposedly a genie and had Goat as her mother - what could be more woeful and pointless than that. He let that feeling pass.

“Ostriches are our father,” she said, “and mind you, just the wild ones,” and she winked at Daniel who was trying to imagine the union of a wild Goat and a wild Ostrich. It was a curious scene, something he never believed his mind would see and he had to shake his head to get over it.

“So you are born as eggs, then?”

“Naah, Master as spirits – hollow spirits if I may say – until we find our vessel,” she said.
“And this is your vessel, right?” Daniel pointed to the matchbox. Bony lady smiled yet another widest of smiles and said –
“My new Master knows everything,” she seemed to be so proud of him. The word “new” had caused a curiosity in a Daniel’s mind and hence he asked her.

“So Lady – Hey by the way, what is your name?” he was kind of embarrassed to have asked her name so late in the conversation. He wondered what he had been calling her till that point.

The Bony Lady seemed to be taken back by this question as if Daniel had asked her to draw the exact structure of Mitochondria - “O-oh. U-umm, I d-don’t know master, “she waved her hand around in surprise, “Nobody has asked me my name in ages, I think.”

“What! You have served people all your seven hundred thirty two years of life and nobody has made the effort to know your name,” Daniel felt aggrieved for her but was also astounded by the fact that he remembered the exact number of years the Bony Lady had lived for.
The Bony Lady was very surprised herself too and she looked with watery eyes towards Daniel, “Master, you name me.”

“W-w-whoa, now this is some responsibility!” Daniel exclaimed and felt a bit overwhelmed, as if somebody had asked him to rear up a teenager. “A thing – sorry – a person didnt have a name for over seven hundred years and suddenly that responsibility falls on me. Very unfair,” he tut-tutted, “how does Selvy sound to you?” he was surprised by the pace with which mind had come up with a name, never mind how foolish it sounded.

The Bony lady rolled her eyes around for an instant, as if trying the multitude scenarios in which her name would be called which were nothing a big fat zero till then, and said “It doesn’t dazzle, you know?”

Daniel tried again, “Sylvia, Selica, Strontia?” he fired the names but each were met by disapproving eyes.
“What is it about starting with letter “S”, Master?” she whined.
Daniel came up with twenty names in alphabets from T to Z and all were rejected – the closest which came to approval was Zitty but the Bony Lady thought it to be too classy for her taste. Daniel tried to convince her but she wouldn’t budge and now they had reached the alphabet C but nothing was working. It had been an almost hour since when this game started and Daniel was starting to lose it now. He was trying hard to not scream at her (less realistic) or kick her (most realistic) and that is when the Bony lady said –
“How about Selvy?

“B-but this was the first name I told you,” spoke Daniel, gnashing his teeth and walking towards her, tightening his calf muscles to kick her. But this aggressive posturing had no effect on the Bony Lady who was now trying out her name in multitude of scenarios while talking to herself. It felt just fine to her and it was evident with that beaming smile of hers which had returned to her face. She sang the following –

“What can Selvy do for you, Master?” and her white marble eyes twinkled a little too.
